department.ch: 人力資源管理研究所碩士班

goal.en: “Research Method (II) is the second of a two-course methods sequence designed to provide Ph.D. students in Human Resource Management with tools and skills necessary in quantitative research. This course focuses on the application of the research methods in OBHR and social science studies. The objective of this course is to help students familiar with the application of the research methods learned in the course of Research Method (I); therefore, many research papers published in the academic journals will be presented and discussed in the class. A good understanding will enable students to apply these techniques, as well as acquire on their own additional multivariate statistical techniques rooted in these methodologies.“

content.en:
Introduction (Mplus, Amos, SPSS, Stata)
Management: meanings, methods and moxie
Measurement theory
Measurement: EFA, CFA
Regression: moderating effect
Regression: mediating effect
Regression: moderated mediation / mediated moderation
Multilevel modeling (regression-based): multilevel mediation / moderation Hierarchical linear model (HLM)
Structural equation modeling (SEM)
Multilevel modeling (SEM based)
Longitudinal analysis: multilevel longitudinal, latent growth curves, cross-lagged models
Longitudinal mediation/moderation
Term paper presentation
